fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35351].
  {panel}

Make a view for page/page-tree organization that allows documentation experts to easily re-organize where pages are located.

Right now it seems that it's only possible to organize pages by going to the page itself and re-assigning it's parent page.  While this is functional, it can be very difficult to work with when you have hundreds of documents that need to put into a proper location.  This problem is compounded when you're doing "clean up" work and are not even sure where you are going to put said pages.

The great thing about an explorer style view (folders/sub-folders) is that you can quickly create a few basic folders simply to start putting documents into broad categories.  Then you can go into those folders and break them down further.  It's great when you can do this in real time, but if we can't drag and drop and instead have to go to the page and find the parent we want to give it...  It becomes cumbersome.

So if we could have an explorer view for organization, that would be great.
fields.summary: Explorer view for page organization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35331].
  {panel}

The page properties report macro had a bug in it - CONF-30125 - where it would display pages without regard to the privacy of the page itself.

While this is a security risk, there are customers who've come to rely on this functionality. For example, one customer uses it to display the overall status of a project, without exposing the particulars of a project to the whole of their staff.

After the bug was fixed in CONF-30125, reports only displayed items that the viewer had access to - which causes problems for customers who were relying on it's previous behaviour.

It would be nice if there was an option to "impersonate" a user - that is, to list pages that the _impersonated_ user could see (rather than the viewer); along with the appropriate notice that it is a security risk.
fields.summary: Add an impersonation option to the Page Properties Report Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35323].
  {panel}

Apparently the JIRA Issues Macro used to have the ability to define sorting and pagination. CONF-29991 addressed this concern, but sorting was never introduced as a parameter that can be defined on the macro itself. Instead, sorting is undefined when the table is loaded and the viewer of the page can sort as they like.

The initial sorting should be able to be defined so that the document can display issues in the order the document embedding the view is concerned with (e.g. fixVersion, updated, etc.). Interaction with the table should be left in (could be an option to disable even).

If adding it to the macro parameters is undesirable for some reason, the macro should at least respect the sorting that the filter itself defines. It currently does not, as mentioned here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/228129/answers/9871223?flashId=-257275889

h3. Workaround

Using the direct JQL instead of a filter allows the JIRA Issues macro to respect the ORDER BY clause of the query.
fields.summary: Add ability to predefine ordering of JIRA Issues Macro/respect filter order by

fields.description:
When a page contains headings with international characters, the fragment identifier (the "id" attribute of the corresponding heading) should not be URL encoded.

Confluence is incorrectly encoding this "id" attribute, which breaks the inter-page links created by the TOC macro in Firefox.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# create a page containing lots of blank lines, followed by the heading {{Á}}
# in the beginning of the page, include the TOC macro, which will create a link to the {{A}} section
# save the page
# using Firefox, click on the link in the TOC

*Expected results:* The browser should scroll to the {{A}} section

*Actual results:* nothing happens


At first I thought this was a Firefox bug, but it turns out it's a Confluence bug. Additional details:
 - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=643275
 - https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=56733
fields.summary: Headings' "id" attribute is incorrectly URL encoded

fields.description:
When Confluence has Application Links created for more than one JIRA, if the user tries to create a new issue through JIRA Issues Macro on the JIRA that is not set to primary on the applinks list, Confluence actually creates the issue on the primary JIRA instead.

Also, if both projects (from Primary JIRA and the other JIRA) have different types for issues, the creation button won't work, keeping Confluence on the same screen.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Install 2 JIRA 6.2.3 instances
*On JIRA 1*
# Create a new Software Development project called "Project1"
*On JIRA 2*
# Create a new Simple Issue Tracking project called "Project2"
(i) The Project Type does not matter, we just need to create a custom Issue Type
# On JIRA2. create a custom Issue Type called "new", for example
# Now, install a Confluence 5.6.3
# Create the application links between Confluence and those 2 JIRA instances
# Set *JIRA1* to primary on Confluence's applinks list
# Create a page on Confluence
# Insert the JIRA Issues Macro
# Create a new issue
# Server = JIRA1, Project = Project1, issue type = Bug, fill in summary and description
# Click insert
#* Issue is created and displayed on page
# Save the page
# Edit the page
# Insert the JIRA Issues Macro
# Create a new issue
# Server = JIRA2, Project = Project2, issue type = new, fill in summary
# Click on insert
#* No response - popup still open, nothing changed
# Change issue type to _New Feature_, fill in summary 
# Click on insert
#* The issue is inserted, however, if you look at this just created issue, it was actually created on JIRA1 (Project1) instead of JIRA2 (Project2)

Also, another issue related to this bug is if the secondary JIRA (JIRA2) has 2 projects while the primary JIRA (JIRA1) has only one. If the user selects the second project, Confluence shows a red error text: "Project is required"
fields.summary: Confluence does not respect the selected application when creating an issue through the JIRA Issues Macro.

fields.description:
Confluence logs an error when reindexing attachments with minor edit set to true. 
* In some cases the index will not complete, despite the indexes being rebuilt from scratch. 
* Restrictions do not make a difference.
* Minor Edit is set to true in the contentproperties table when an attachment is added using drag-and-drop. 

Here is the error:
{code}
2015-11-23 20:14:16,197 ERROR [Indexer: 3] [confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch] indexCollection Exception indexing document with id: 15434444
 -- referer: https://secure.compandsave.com/confluence/admin/search-indexes.action | url: /confluence/admin/reindex.action | userName: xxxx | action: reindex
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: searchable: Attachment: New Hire - i-9.pdf v.1 (16023917) michaelc is not supported: Attachments with minor edit set to true are not accounted for in the change index
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.AddChangeDocumentIndexTask.<init>(AddChangeDocumentIndexTask.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.IndexTaskFactory.createAddChangeDocumentTask(IndexTaskFactory.java:133)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.RebuildChangeDocumentsIndexTask.perform(RebuildChangeDocumentsIndexTask.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch.indexCollection(ReindexWorkBatch.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch.lambda$executeTransaction$417(ReindexWorkBatch.java:109)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch$$Lambda$187/1248108333.doInTransaction(Unknown Source)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch.executeTransaction(ReindexWorkBatch.java:84)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch.run(ReindexWorkBatch.java:72)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.tenant.TenantGate$3.call(TenantGate.java:164)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}

As a workaround, minor edit may be set to false in the database with a query such as the following which was tested on PostgreSQL:
{code}update contentproperties set longval = '0' 
where propertyname = 'MINOR_EDIT' and contentid = (select contentid from content where contenttype = 'ATTACHMENT' and title = '_attachment name from error message_'){code}
fields.summary: Attachments with minor edit set to true are not accounted for in the change index

fields.description:
1. Create a simple blueprint. In the atlassian-plugin.xml set the blueprint name to "name1" like so:
{code}
<blueprint key="my-blueprint" content-template-key="simplebp-template" index-key="my-index" name="name1"/>
{code}
Observe that the attribute used is "name", which is not documented here: https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Blueprint+Module

2. Upload your plugin
3. In Confluence click "Create" and verify your new blueprint is there
4. Go to Space Tools > Content Tools
5. Observe your blueprint is listed as "name1"
6. In atlassian-plugin.xml change the name of the blueprint to "name2"
7. Rebuild your plugin and upload it
8. Go to Go to Space Tools > Content Tools and observe your blueprint is still listed as "name1"
9. Go to Confluence Admin > Add-ons and view the modules for your plugin
10. Observe that here the module is labeled as "name2"

*Workaround:*

The name property of plugins and their modules are stored in the {{ao_54c900_content_blueprint_ao}} table of the database. They can be changed with an update statement. Please shutdown your instance before running this query: 

{code}update ao_54c900_content_blueprint_ao set name = '<new_name>' where plugin_module_key = '<your_module_key>';{code}
fields.summary: Blueprint name in Content Tools cannot be updated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35291].
{panel}
h3. Current Behaviour

When creating or editing a Global Template and trying to add the ‘Create from template’ Macro the macro one of two things will occur:
 # The editor hangs. Dropdowns aren't responsive.
 # The editor loads, but the Template Name drop down list is not responsive. Because of this it's not possible to use the macro.

!Screen Shot 2014-10-16 at 8.38.41 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Error message

404 error is thrown in the browser console:
 !Screen Shot 2014-10-15 at 9.23.20 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workarounds

Workaround 1 (Recommended):
 # Add the Create from Template macro to the Global Template
 # Add any existing key to the Space Key (the bottom field in the macro)
 # Now you can use the drop down and select the template to create from.
 # Save the template, and then Edit it once again. This time remove the space key and save the template.

Workaround 2:
 # edit regular (non-template) Confluence page and add the ‘Create from template’ Macro to it;
 # copy the macro from the page editor;
 # edit a Global Template and past the macro copied in previous step;
 # save the template - the macro button will work as expected.
fields.summary: Unable to add ‘Create from template’ Macro to a Global Template

fields.description:
I have now encountered this 3 times in editing a page and trying to paste a table from an older version of confluence.

Repro steps:

1. Edit the page.
2. Insert headining 2 using h2. macro
3. Paste a table
4. Try to save

I get this error:



The following error(s) occurred:

    The editor content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 205992. Parser message: Unexpected character '=' (code 61) (expected a name start character) at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,205992]

It won't allow me to save the page OR undo my paste!!!  So, I lost my previously inserted content (which I hadn't saved) just because of one paste!!

In this day and age, its atrocious that any editor should lose content typed by user because it cannot parse something??!!!!  Really?  Can you imagine how a user would feel if your software loses their many hours of work simply because you can't parse a cut and paste???

As it happens, I didn't lose a lot of work but I have to tell you, I really got annoyed a lot.  A horrible, horrible user experience.  If this were to happen during my evaluation of this software, I assure you it would be pretty much a deal breaker.  No software should EVER lose a user's content let alone a content management system!

See picture attached.
fields.summary: Editor save fails with bizzare error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35285].
  {panel}

h2. Summary
Slowness Rendering a Page with the 'Section' Macro

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page
# Select the 'Edit' option from the top right menu
# type ‘{section’ to bring up the section macro and select it
# Enter information in the ‘Section’ macro.  (I saw the degradation grow as multiple items were added, but over 100 items is very noticeable)
# Save the page (should be slow)
# Navigate away and back to the page (should be slow)

*If the same information is entered on a page without the section macro, it renders without speed degradation.* 

h2. Expected Result
The page would render normally and not take a noticeable amount of time to do so

h2. Actual Result
- The page takes a noticeable amount of time to render
- In Confluence Cloud any text that does not render within a section column within 60 seconds will be truncated from the page (Location of text is random within document)
-- Effects are compounded if using firefox with FireBug enabled

h2. Environment
Confluence 5.4.4

h2. Other Notes
* I have attached a Storage format of a page that has many items (so that it is easier to recreate by adding through source editor)
* If you remove the data from the Section macro, the page renders very quickly.  That is reason for submitting this as a bug as it seems to be an issue with the ‘Section’ Macro itself
* Only tested on Confluence 5.4.4 and 5.6.3.  Issue is present in both.
fields.summary: Slowness Rendering a Page with the 'Section' Macro
Applying styles to multiple selected ranges does not work

fields.description:
h2. Summary

In Confluence, while using Windows and Internet Explorer 10, the ‘Page Layout’ option when editing a page causes the footer to expand hiding while hiding the title.


h2. Steps to Reproduce

# Log in to Confluence
# Create a new page
# Choose the ‘Page Layout’ option and enter enough information in the text box to cause the screen to scroll
# From the ‘Page Layout’ option, select ‘Add section’ and put a single line of text in the newly created, separate box
# Save the page
# Click ‘Edit’ on the page

h2. Expected Result

The edit page will appear normally with a single footer line and the title bar viewable

h2. Actual Result
The title bar is not viewable (even after scrolling) and the usual single line footer is about 4 times larger from the bottom of the page

h2. Environment
Windows 7
Internet Explorer 10 (Firefox functions correctly as do other versions of IE)
Confluence versions 5.5.4 and 5.6.3 (I only tested these versions)

h2. Other Notes
* Only browser this appears to effect is IE10
* This could be effecting multiple versions of Confluence
* If you refresh the page, it will then appear as expected without any issues
* The page refresh appears to correct the issue until something is added, removed or changed on the page
fields.summary: In Confluence, while using Windows and Internet Explorer 10, the ‘Page Layout’ option when editing a page causes the footer to expand, hiding while hiding the title.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35265].
  {panel}

My recommendation for the product as it stands now would be to be able to break spaces up by configuring individual charts. Currently, when using the chart macro in conjunction with the Usage Statistics macro the output is too congested when all spaces are in a single chart making it unusable.

We would like a single chart that:
* Shows the space of all spaces across Confluence, and new spaces are added automatically to the chart
* You can toggle individual stats to be displayed on and off easily (so that you'd avoid the clutter of having all spaces showing at one time)
* You could specify space (specific spaces by key, @global, @personal, etc.)
* You could also toggle the spaces being displayed in the graph by clicking them on and off.

fields.description:
Importing an image file (or other file types like .dmg or .pptx) show an error message saying the file isn't a "valid Word 97-2003 document" (see attachment)

So...only .doc files are supported then? 

Import a .docx file (2007 and later versions of MS Word), and this succeeds! Error message is thus incorrect/outdated.

.txt files also work, as does .html and .xml (probably plenty of others too). Feature is thus incorrectly named (unless these count as word documents?)

Then...import a PDF file. Successfully uploads, but you get an awful mess of binary data converted to who knows what... (see attachment) It can end up being a really, really long page of this.

Need:
- file type restrictions
- file size restrictions? 
- updated error message
- clarification of what this feature SHOULD be allowed to convert
fields.summary: "Import Word Document" feature has a lot of issues

fields.description:
We are trying to add the JIRA macro to our confluence dashboard to enable each Confluence user to see their Unresolved JIRA Issues. 

It works great if a user has JIRA tickets assigned to them however if a user has no JIRA tickets assigned to them the macro presents the tickets of the person that added the macro. 

This is incorrect - there should be a warning to say the current assignee has no JIRA tickets assigned to them.

Please note that this does not only apply to the Confluence Dashboard but also seems to appear on normal pages as well.

To replicate:
1. User 1 who has some JIRA tickets adds a JIRA macro to a page of confluence or the confluence dashboard with the jql as: assignee = currentUser() AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY updatedDate DESC 
2. User 1 logs out of confluence.
3. User 2 with no JIRA tickets logs in to confluence and navigates to the page created by User 1
4. User 2 will see the tickets of User 1 as opposed to a message saying no tickets found based on the filters applied.

Tested with multiple users who seem to have the same issue
fields.summary: JIRA Macro assignee = currentUser () does not work correctly for users with no JIRA tickets assigned to them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35242].
  {panel}

Currently, we have a system whereby you 'promote' a template to hide all other templates. I think this is a departure from what a user would normally expect. 'Unpromote' is also not a real word.

As a user, I simply want to be able to drag templates into the order I choose, without going to the trouble of promoting every one I want to use.

Can we implement drag to reorder in the template dialogue, to allow users to move their favourite templates/blueprints to the top of the dialogue (or put them in whatever order they want to)?

Templates can still be disabled if users really don't want to see them, and I think (not sure if there are any customer interviews about this) that most people probably want the convenience of seeing their most-used templates at the top where they're easy to choose.
fields.summary: Drag to reorder templates/blueprints

This one is related to [this older improvement request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-30105] which is about providing different blog spaces per *Space*. Given that, here's one example of the request:

Let's suppose that the company meetings must have a 1:1 correspondence with Confluence spaces. Let's say that we have a space called ProjectAlpha to create a new piece of software.

Now say we have some standing meetings for parts of the project like UI, Design Review, Release Planning, Documentation. Each of these wants a blog for the ongoing weekly notes.

Note this is just one project in the company. There is no desire to make spaces for each meeting: AlphaUI, AlphaReleasePlanning, etc. These do not necessarily make sense as spaces.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently to access a page or space in Confluence you either need a Confluence license, or the page has to be open to anonymous users. But some users want to be able to share a page in Confluence without it being open to the whole public and not to only Confluence users

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to password-protect a page in Confluence that is anonymous so users can view it, or send email links to users that only they can use to access the page.
fields.summary: Ability to provide password protected access to a single page or space
DeleteDuplicateTasksUpgradeTask fails on Oracle when there are more than 1000 pages with tasks
Macro: incoming links
Fail Over LDAP Parameter
Allow filtering of comments within a page by date range

fields.description: Usually when edit rights are restricted as a normal user you don't see the "Edit" button. When editing is restricted to a specific admin user and another admin user wants to edit, he/she does sees the Edit button but only after hitting Save you'll get the error you're not permitted to do so.
fields.summary: As an Admin able to edit but not permitted due to restrictions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35213].
  {panel}

At the moment it does not support fields like Epic Link, or Epic Name. 

That could be useful to:
 - make 2 dimensional graphs showing how many stories are in which status per epic
 - make pie charts comparing epic size, or completeness.

I speculate that you can work around it by changing the Jira Issue table to renderMode=static and using the normal Chart macro. 

But I can't figure that out at all.
fields.summary: Better JIRA Agile support for JIRA Issues Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35212].
  {panel}

A user "User1" can have the right to create new blog entries in a personal space of another user "User2". If you go to the blog overview in that space, e.g. https://confluence/pages/viewrecentblogposts.action?key=~User2
everything is fine. In the heading of the page the logo of User2 is displayed and for the single blog entry the logo of the creator (User1 in our case) is shown. Fine

But if you display a single specfic blog entry (e.g. https://confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=12345678), than the semantic of the headline should change. It does still show the logo of the space owner User2 instead of the creator of this single blog entry User1! But the name of the author is shown correct, only the logo is wrong.

The behaviour is identical for normal spaces, but in a normal space you have a neutral space logo, so there is no mismatch between logo and author. But in personal spaces there is a mismatch for foreign authors ...
fields.summary: Display of a single blog entry should use the logo from the author

Grzanie w zimie

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35209].
  {panel}

h3. ***Current Behaviour***
Documents with '&' in the file name cannot be edited

h3. ***Expected Behaviour***
Documents can be edited despite any characters in the file name

h3. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# Attach a document that has the character '&' in the file name
# *Edit in Office*
# The file cannot be opened with the following errors
!editInOffice.png!
!editInOffice2.png!

***Current Workaround***
Edit the file name and remove '&'
fields.summary: Edit in Office is Broken if File Name Contains Ampersand '&'
